intro: Quararibea latilimbata, commonly known as the broad-leafed quina, is a small evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of the understory in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
